page.title: 17GOYT VALLEY TRAFFIC SCHEME
page.content: The Goyt Valley traffic scheme is an exercise in managing the countryside for the benefit of all concerned,whether they be walkers, motorists.farmers or foresters.On summer weekends non-essential traffic is banned on the main valley road between The Street and Derbyshire Bridge.This allows visitors to leave their cars and walk along the traffic-free roads to better appreciate the beauty of the valley. Special facilities have been provided by the National Park Authority to help people enjoy their visit to the valley.These include waymarked walks,a nature trail and picnic areas adjoining the car parks.
